books.title: The Charwoman’s Shadow
books.author: Lord Dunsany
books.summary: A young nobleman becomes a magician to secure his sister’s marriage.

books.title: Kim
books.author: Rudyard Kipling
books.summary: An orphaned street-urchin follows a holy man across India during the time of the British Raj, eventually gaining an education and becoming a recruit to the Great Game of espionage against the Russians.

books.title: An Autobiography
books.author: Theodore Roosevelt
books.summary: The autobiography of American President Theodore Roosevelt.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: Alice’s Adventures in Wonderland
books.author: Lewis Carroll
books.summary: A young girl follows a white rabbit into a strange land of poetry, humor, and whimsy.

books.title: Leave It to Psmith
books.author: P. G. Wodehouse
books.summary: Psmith inveigles himself into Blandings Castle to help out a friend and to pursue love.

books.title: The Two Gentlemen of Verona
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: Two best friends become involved in a love triangle.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: R. A. Lafferty
books.summary: A collection of science fiction and fantasy stories by R. A. Lafferty ordered by date of publication.

books.title: The Jungle
books.author: Upton Sinclair
books.summary: A working-class Lithuanian immigrant family’s struggle to make a living in the turn-of-the-century Chicago stockyards.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Frank Belknap Long
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Frank Belknap Long, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: Commentaries on the Gallic War
books.author: Julius Caesar
books.summary: Julius Caesar’s account of the conflicts between Rome and Gaul in the later years of the Roman republic.

books.title: Ralestone Luck
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: The descendants of a noble family, and of pirates, seek to restore their fortunes by locating the “luck” of their family.

books.title: Wonderful Adventures of Mrs. Seacole in Many Lands
books.author: Mary Seacole
books.summary: A British Creole woman provides medical assistance during the Crimean War after her travels around Panama.

books.title: A Voyage to Arcturus
books.author: David Lindsay
books.summary: One man’s journey through a psychedelic alien landscape of philosophy, religion, life, and death.

books.title: Songs of the Cattle Trail and Cow Camp
books.author: John A. Lomax
books.summary: A collection of cowboy poetry collected by folklorist John A. Lomax.

books.title: The Importance of Being Earnest
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A comedy skewering Victorian high society.

books.title: Voodoo Planet
books.author: Andre Norton
books.summary: Dane Thorson travels to the safari planet Khatka and encounters an evil witch doctor.

books.title: Vikram and the Vampire
books.author: Richard F. Burton
books.summary: King Vikram becomes trapped in a cycle of stories as he tries to capture a cunning vampire.

books.title: Heretics
books.author: G. K. Chesterton
books.summary: A collection of essays in which G. K. Chesterton debates the intellectuals of his day on a range of topics.

books.title: The Giant Raft
books.author: Jules Verne
books.summary: An ex-slave trader with an encrypted note schemes about its meaning, while a man with a secret past travels with his family down the Amazon in a giant raft to attend his daughter’s wedding.
